subject: Getting JUnit 4 from CVS with Eclipse
msgSnippet: ... I did it just now, using eclipse 3.2-M1. ... I used anonymous/, i.e. no password: https://sourceforge.net/cvs/?group_id=15278 ... I.e. no password. This
messageBody:
quikdraw2700 09/16/2005 02:12:41 PM:
> I'm having trouble checking the JUnit4 code out of CVS to try this
> among other things. Have you been successful at accessing the JUnit4
> branch from CVS at SourceForge?

I did it just now, using eclipse 3.2-M1.

> Did you use an anonymous/anonymous account?

I used anonymous/, i.e. no password:

https://sourceforge.net/cvs/?group_id=15278
>> Anonymous CVS Access

>> This project's SourceForge.net CVS repository can be checked out
>> through anonymous (pserver) CVS with the following instruction set.
>> The module you wish to check out must be specified as the
>> modulename. When prompted for a password for anonymous, simply press
>> the Enter key.

I.e. no password. This translates into an eclipse Repository Location
like

Host=cvs.sourceforge.net
Repository path=/cvsroot/junit
User=anonymous
Password=
Connection Type=pserver

Don't worry about the login, eclipse takes care of it. Browse to
module=junit (dunno why but browse seems to work better with SF),
checkout as project, refresh tags, choose branch=Version4, Finish.
